ygData.subject: RE: Guild Training
ygData.msgSnippet: and just so you know:  in the Temple of Marr you find Palys AND clerics. (mostly clerics, but paladins also.) ... From: Perhaps a Princess...
ygData.messageBody:
and just so you know: in the Temple of Marr you find Palys AND clerics.
(mostly clerics, but paladins also.)

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Monday, November 22, 1999 12:52 PM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Guild Training


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

Clerics and paladins may be a special case. Sometimes their guild is the
exact same building, even.
In Qeynos, there are two different temples, both shared by clerics and
paladins of a specific god.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Marquardt, Kris L. [mailto:Kris_Marquardt@...]
>Sent: Monday, November 22, 1999 7:37 AM
>To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
>Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Guild Training
>
>
>From: "Marquardt, Kris L." <Kris_Marquardt@...>
>
>Last time I leveled I went back to Freeport to train. Not knowing the area
>very well I managed to go to the Paladin's guild instead of the cleric's
>guild without realizing it (yes, I know, not very clever but it was very
>late). I located a trainer there and the system allowed her to train me.
>Just curious if any one else has done this and if this might allow a player
>to literally use any guild to train in. This has ,embarrassingly enough,
>worked twice for me.
>
>Heisler
>18th Lvl Dwarven Cleric of Brell
>Armigers of Mirth, E'ci
>
>>
